Submodules

news_app.admin module

Django admin configuration for news_app models.

This module registers models with the Django admin interface and configures their display and editing options.

class news_app.admin.ArticleAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin interface for Article model.

news_app.apps module

News application configuration.

class news_app.apps.NewsAppConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

Configuration for the news_app application.

Django app configuration that handles app initialization and signal registration.

Variables:

  • default_auto_field – Default primary key field type

  • name – Application name

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'news_app'
ready()[source]

Import signal handlers when the app is ready.

This method is called when Django starts and ensures that signal handlers are registered. Currently, signals are imported automatically via Django’s signal discovery.

class news_app.forms.UserRegistrationForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Form for user registration with role selection.

Extends Django’s UserCreationForm to include email and role fields. Users can register as Reader, Journalist, Editor, or Publisher.

Variables:

  • email – Email field (required)

  • role – Role selection field with radio buttons

news_app.models module

Models for the news application.

This module contains all database models including CustomUser, Publisher, Article, and Newsletter with proper relationships and constraints.

class news_app.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Article model representing news articles.

Articles must be approved by an editor before publication, unless they are independently published by the journalist.

Variables:

  • title (CharField) – The title of the article

  • content (TextField) – The full content of the article

  • summary (TextField) – Optional summary of the article (max 500 chars)

  • author (ForeignKey) – The journalist who authored the article

  • publisher (ForeignKey) – Optional publisher associated with article

  • independently_published (BooleanField) – Whether article was self-published

  • is_approved (BooleanField) – Whether article has been approved by editor

  • approved_by (ForeignKey) – Editor who approved the article

  • is_rejected (BooleanField) – Whether article has been rejected

  • rejected_reason (TextField) – Reason for rejection if rejected

  • rejected_by (ForeignKey) – Editor who rejected the article

  • approval_date (DateTimeField) – When article was approved

  • rejected_date (DateTimeField) – When article was rejected

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – When article was created

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – When article was last updated

  • published_date (DateTimeField) – When article was published

  • image (ImageField) – Optional image for the article

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approval_date

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

approved_by

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

author_id
clean()[source]

Validate article data and relationships.

Ensures:

  • Author must be a journalist

  • Approver must be an editor

  • Independent articles cannot be approved/rejected by editors

Raises:

ValidationError – If validation fails

class news_app.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model with role-based fields.

Extends Django’s AbstractUser to include role-specific fields and subscription management. Supports four roles: reader, editor, journalist, and publisher.

Variables:

  • role (CharField) – User’s role (reader, editor, journalist, publisher)

  • subscribed_newsletters (ManyToManyField) – Newsletters user subscribes to

  • subscribed_publishers (ManyToManyField) – Publishers user subscribes to

  • subscribed_journalists (ManyToManyField) – Journalists user subscribes to

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – Timestamp when user was created

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – Timestamp when user was last updated

Note

Journalist-specific content is accessed via reverse relations: - independent_articles (from Article.author) - independent_newsletters (from Newsletter.author)

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'), ('publisher', 'Publisher')]
approved_articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

auth_token

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

get_next_by_created_at(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: created_at>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_next_by_date_joined(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: date_joined>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_next_by_updated_at(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: updated_at>, is_next=True, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_created_at(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: created_at>, is_next=False, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_date_joined(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: date_joined>, is_next=False, **kwargs)
get_previous_by_updated_at(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: updated_at>, is_next=False, **kwargs)
get_role_display(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.CharField: role>)
groups

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

independent_articles

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class news_app.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Newsletter model representing periodic publications.

Newsletters can be published by journalists independently or through a publisher. Unlike articles, newsletters do not require editor approval.

Variables:

  • title (CharField) – The title of the newsletter

  • content (TextField) – The full content of the newsletter

  • author (ForeignKey) – The journalist who authored the newsletter

  • publisher (ForeignKey) – Optional publisher associated with newsletter

  • published_date (DateTimeField) – When newsletter was published

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – When newsletter was created

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – When newsletter was last updated

exception DoesNotExist

class news_app.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Publisher model representing news organizations.

A Publisher represents a news organization that can publish articles and newsletters. Publishers have owners, editors, and journalists associated with them.

Variables:

  • name (CharField) – The name of the publisher (unique)

  • description (TextField) – Optional description of the publisher

  • website (URLField) – Optional website URL

  • established_date (DateField) – Optional date when publisher was established

  • owner (ForeignKey) – The user who owns this publisher

  • created_by (ForeignKey) – The user who created this publisher

  • editors (ManyToManyField) – Editors associated with this publisher

  • journalists (ManyToManyField) – Journalists associated with this publisher

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – Timestamp when publisher was created

  • updated_at (DateTimeField) – Timestamp when publisher was last updated

exception DoesNotExist

class news_app.models.PublisherJoinRequest(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a request to join a publisher organization.

Journalists and editors can request to join a publisher. The publisher owner can approve or reject these requests.

Variables:

  • user (ForeignKey) – The user requesting to join (journalist or editor)

  • publisher (ForeignKey) – The publisher being requested to join

  • status (CharField) – Status of the request (pending, approved, rejected)

  • message (TextField) – Optional message from the requester

  • created_at (DateTimeField) – When the request was created

  • reviewed_at (DateTimeField) – When the request was reviewed

  • reviewed_by (ForeignKey) – User who reviewed the request

Note

There can only be one pending request per user-publisher pair.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

STATUS_CHOICES = [('pending', 'Pending'), ('approved', 'Approved'), ('rejected', 'Rejected')]

news_app.permissions module

Custom permission classes for role-based access control.

This module defines permission classes that restrict access based on user roles (Reader, Editor, Journalist).

class news_app.permissions.IsEditor[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Permission class that allows only users with Editor role.

This permission checks if the user has the ‘editor’ role.

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check if user has editor role.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object

  • view (View) – The view being accessed

Returns:

True if user is an editor, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

class news_app.permissions.IsEditorOrReadOnly[source]

Bases: BasePermission

Permission allowing editors to edit, others to read.

This permission allows editors to modify/delete content, while allowing read-only access to all authenticated users.

has_permission(request, view)[source]

Check permissions based on request method.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object

  • view (View) – The view being accessed

Returns:

True if user has appropriate permissions

Return type:

bool

news_app.signals module

Signal handlers for the news application.

This module contains signal handlers that trigger when articles are approved, sending email notifications to subscribers and posting to Twitter/X.

news_app.signals.notify_subscribers_on_approval(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Send email notifications and post to Twitter when an article is approved.

This signal handler is triggered after an Article is saved. If the article has just been approved, it: 1. Sends email notifications to all subscribers 2. Posts to Twitter/X

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (Article).

  • instance – The actual instance being saved.

  • created – Boolean indicating if this is a new instance.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

news_app.signals.send_email_notifications(article)[source]

Send email notifications to all subscribers.

Collects all subscribers to the article’s publisher and author, then sends mass email notifications about the new article.

Parameters:

article (Article) – The Article instance that was approved

Note

The article author is excluded from the notification list. Uses Django’s send_mass_mail for efficient bulk email sending.

news_app.signals.set_approval_date(sender, instance, **kwargs)[source]

Set approval date when article is approved.

Parameters:

  • sender – The model class (Article).

  • instance – The actual instance being saved.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments.

news_app.urls module

URL configuration for news_app.

This module defines all URL patterns for both web views and API endpoints.

news_app.views module

Views for the news application.

This module contains template-based views for the web interface and API views for the RESTful API.

class news_app.views.ArticleDetailView(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: DetailView

Display detailed view of a single article.

Shows full article content with permissions: - Public: Only approved articles - Editors: All articles - Journalists: Approved articles + their own articles

Variables:

  • model – Article model class

  • template_name – Template to render

  • context_object_name – Name of article object in template

context_object_name = 'article'
get_queryset()[source]

Return articles based on user permissions.

model

alias of Article

template_name = 'news_app/article_detail.html'

class news_app.views.ArticleViewSet(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelViewSet

ViewSet for Article CRUD operations via API.

Provides full CRUD functionality for articles with role-based permissions: - Journalists: Can create articles - Editors: Can update/delete any article - All authenticated users: Can view approved articles

Variables:

  • queryset – Base queryset for articles

  • permission_classes – Base permission classes

basename = None
description = None
detail = None
get_permissions()[source]

Return permission instances for actions.

Returns:

Permission classes based on action:

  • create: IsJournalist

  • update/partial_update/destroy: IsEditor

  • Other: IsAuthenticated

Return type:

list

get_queryset()[source]

Return articles filtered by user role.

Returns:

Filtered articles based on user role

(Editors: All articles, Journalists: Approved + own, Others: Approved only) :rtype: QuerySet

Returns:

ArticleCreateSerializer for create action,

ArticleSerializer for all other actions :rtype: class

class news_app.views.SubscriptionArticlesView(**kwargs)[source]

Returns articles from publishers and journalists that the authenticated reader is subscribed to. Only available to readers.
